column4: Does anyone know how I can apply a custom album art cover to an entire album of .MP3 files?  Amarok only lets you use Amazon or custom pictures for individual files.
by default Amarok applies the album art to all songs in that album...
It only does that if you use Amazon to find the art.  If you want to set a custom cover, you can only do that one file at a time.
I've done it with a custom cover. it was for an album w/ 500 songs. all have it now.
How did you do that?  I can't change the art when I have more than one file selected.
the same way as usual. select one track and change its album art. it should automatically apply to allt he others
Yeah, I would have assumed so too... but it's only applying it to that one file, not the entire album.
odd. is the album naem the same?
yes, identical.... all the songs are listed under the same album in Amarok too
that is weird...
maybe you messing with it before screwed something up . your solution might just be to do it manually fo that album.
i just did it to experiment. worked fine.
Well, that's the beauty of Linux... just because it works for 50 other people, doesn't mean it will for the other 50 ;)
true enough. do yuo have an album art image in the folder. or more than one?
No, I have the album art images in separate folders and I'm trying to apply them to the albums in my collection.... not working.
i did put the album art in the same folder as the files. maybe that helps?
Do you have to name it something specific?
not that i know of. mine was just random letters.
I want the art to be embedded in the MP3, though, so when I tranfer it to my mp3 player, it works well.
Hmm... even fetching a cover from Amazon doesn't apply it to the entire album.
i'm not sure if Amarok does that. i think so, tho. You should try #amarok for experts
